title: Interpretation of table of CPI data over time

content.question:
The table provided shows the end-of-year consumer price index (<math alttext="C P I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CPI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) for an economy.

Year
 <math alttext="C P I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CPI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

2008
 <math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

2009
 <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

2010
 <math alttext="105" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>105</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Which of the following statements is true based on the information given?

choices.label: The inflation rate in 2009 was <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent.
The base year for the price index is 2008.
The inflation rate was higher in 2010 than in 2009.
The inflation rate in 2010 was <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent.
Prices of all products rose in 2009 and 2010.

content.answer: The inflation rate in 2010 was <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent.
